thread.title: Martinez wins again at HCISD meet
thread.title_full: Martinez wins again at HCISD meet

author: MARK MOLINA, Staff Writer
title: Martinez wins again at HCISD meet
text:
Martinez wins again at HCISD meet By MARK MOLINA, Staff Writer Brownsville Herald 
HARLINGEN — It was business as usual for Edcouch Elsa’s Krysta Martinez. 
The senior cross-country runner notched her fourth first-place finish of the year Saturday morning at the HCISD Cross-country Invitational. 
Martinez, a 2014 state qualifier, finished with a personal-best time of 18 minutes, 7.12 seconds, edging Rivera’s Andrea Delarosa (18:07.56). 
Martinez hopes to continue to improve and make another state run. 
“My times have been improving steadily and are a little faster this year,” Martinez said. “I hit my PR this week, but I want to get into the 17-minute range by regionals and hopefully finish in the top three at the state meet. 
“Today, however, was a good day for my team and I because we all work hard no matter what.” 
The Lady Jackets finished first overall with 75 points. Hanna (123), Harlingen South (146), PSJA Southwest (148) and PSJA High School (156) rounded out the top five. 
In the boys race, Rivera finished first as a team with 72 points, followed by PSJA Southwest (88), La Joya Juarez-Lincoln (103), Harlingen High (162) and Brownsville Veterans Memorial (164). 
Mercedes’ Jonathan Reyes, another 2014 state qualifier, finished first in the boys race with a personal best time of 15:14, besting Hidalgo’s Moises Campos (15:50.79 and Rivera’s Jonathan Herrera (15:55.84).
